GameState_General Class Reference

Representation of a game of Connect Four to be used if an optimized version cannot be found. More...

Detailed Description

Representation of a game of Connect Four to be used if an optimized version cannot be found.

See also:
GameStateModule
Author:
Leonid Shamis

Definition at line 9 of file GameState_General.java.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

GameState_General.GameState_General ( final int  w,
final int  h 
)

Primary Constructor.

Creates a new game board of the specified width and height. The starting player is player 1 and the board is initially empty and with no undo/redo history.

Parameters:
w The width of the board.
h The height of the board.

boolean GameState_General.canMakeMove ( final int  x  ) 

Returns whether a move is legal.

Returns whether it is legal to drop a coin in the specified column.

Parameters:
x The column to test.
Returns:
Whether it is legal to drop a coin in this column.

void GameState_General.computeVictory (  )  [private]

Used internally to check for victory.

Determines if a player has won the game and updates the state accordingly.

Definition at line 212 of file GameState_General.java.

int GameState_General.getAt ( final int  x,
final int  y 
)

Returns what coin is at the given location.

Returns the value of the coin at position (x, y). If there is no coin, the return value is 0; otherwise it is the 1-based index of the player who placed the coin there.

Parameters:
x The x coordinate to look up.
y The y coordinate to look up.
Returns:
The value of the coin at the given position, or 0 if not present.

Implements GameStateModule.

Definition at line 248 of file GameState_General.java.

int GameState_General.getWinner (  )  throws RuntimeException

Return the winner of the current game.

Returns the index of the winning player. If player 1 wins, the return value is 1. If player 2 wins, the return value is 2. On a draw, the return value is 0. If this function is called and the game is not over, throws a RuntimeException.

Returns:
The index of the winning player.
Exceptions:
RuntimeException If the game is not over.
See also:
isGameOver

Implements GameStateModule.

Definition at line 154 of file GameState_General.java.

boolean GameState_General.isGameOver (  ) 

Check if there exists a victory condition.

Returns:
Whether or not the game is over.

Implements GameStateModule.

Definition at line 138 of file GameState_General.java.

void GameState_General.makeMove ( final int  x  )  throws RuntimeException

Makes the specified move for the active player.

Makes the specified move for the active player. This updates the game history and can be undone with unMakeMove. If the move is illegal, throws a RuntimeException exception.

Parameters:
x The move to be made.
Exceptions:
RuntimeException If the move is illegal.
See also:
unMakeMove

Implements GameStateModule.

Definition at line 92 of file GameState_General.java.

void GameState_General.unMakeMove (  ) 

Undoes the most recent action.

Undoes the last action performed by makeMove. This function can be called multiple successive times, but no more than the number of times that makeMove has been called.

See also:
makeMove

Implements GameStateModule.

final Stack<Integer> GameState_General.history = new Stack<Integer>() [private]

Game history for makeMove / unMakeMove.

This stack is used to keep track of the move history for makeMove and unMakeMove.
